answers.answer: If someone is urinating that much this mean she must have symptoms of sugar. try to reduce their sugar intake. It will certainly help. get her sugar test too.
It does sound like diabetes or kidney issues.  She really needs to see her doc.
The elderly can often have a UTI (urinary tract infection) with no associated pain.  It is very important for her to have a urinalysis done to rule out an infection.
Also possible her bladder is prolapsed or uterus is prolapsed and putting pressure on her bladder (uterine prolapse is common in India/Nepal). A physician visit is important.Sher

question: For about last 7/8 months, my sister (Aged 78) is urinating more than at least 20 times a day. She has no other complaint. What course of action should I take?
title: Frequent urination of a lady
